channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Area uneven dips in both repairs looks like temp tarmac repair!, 14th October
item.description:
Lobleys drive near Stearman Walk bus stop and there are two areas of traffic calming which have small cobble stones, these have broken away loose but were repaired with tarmac, road is very uneven, car hits the dip in road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lobleys Drive, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Farmer widening BOAT, for his own personal benefit. Planning permission? Destruction of hedgerow. Not his land., 14th October
item.description:
On the corner of Betty Roberts lane alongside Ham Brook. Passed Phoenix Meadow.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Blenheim Orchard, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown hedge encroaching onto footpath, 14th October
item.description:
The hedge that runs alongside the foot and cycle path is so overgrown that it covers the pedestrian side of the foot/cycle path. Consequently any pedestrians are forced to walk in the cycle lane side potentially casuing conflict or even accidents.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7-12;14-21, Princess Elizabeth Way, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
